intro: Hieracium mixtibifidum var. mixtibifidum, commonly known as the mixed-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and seeds, making it both a common weed and a subject of ecological study.
